metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The <pattern> element is used to create a graphic that is redrawn at repeated x and y coordinate intervals, to cover an area.
content.html: The <pattern> element is used to create a graphic that is redrawn at repeated x and y coordinate intervals, to cover an area.

content.text: All SVG patterns are defined within a <defs> element. The <defs> element is short for "definitions", and contains definition of special elements (such as patterns).
content.html: All SVG patterns are defined within a <defs> element. The <defs> element is short for "definitions", and contains definition of special elements (such as patterns).

content.text: The <pattern> element has a required id attribute which identifies the pattern. The graphic/image then points to the pattern to use.
content.html: The <pattern> element has a required id attribute which identifies the pattern. The graphic/image then points to the pattern to use.

content.text: Then, inside the <pattern> element, we put one or more elements that will be used as the fill pattern.
content.html: Then, inside the <pattern> element, we put one or more elements that will be used as the fill pattern.

content.text: The following example creates a rectangle filled with small circles:
content.html: The following example creates a rectangle filled with small circles:

syntaxHighlighting.text: <pattern id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse"

<rect width="200" height="100" 
  x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)" 
  />

width="200" height="100" 
  x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)" 
  /

content.code:
<svg width="400" height="110" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<pattern id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
      
<circle cx="10" cy="10" r="10" fill="red" />
    </pattern>
  
</defs>

  <rect width="200" height="100" 
x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)"
/>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text: <pattern id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse"

<rect width="200" height="100" 
  x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)" 
  />

width="200" height="100" 
  x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)" 
  /

content.code_html:
<svg width="400" height="110" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <pattern id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
      <circle cx="10" cy="10" r="10" fill="red" />
    </pattern>
  </defs>

  <rect width="200" height="100" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt1)" />
</svg>

id="patt1" x="0" y="0" width="20" height="20" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse"

content.text: The following example creates a rectangle filled with small light blue rectangles and gradient circles:
content.html: The following example creates a rectangle filled with small light blue rectangles and gradient circles:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" />

width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" /

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="200" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<linearGradient id="grad1">
      <stop 
offset="0%" stop-color="white" />
      <stop 
offset="100%" stop-color="red" />
    </linearGradient>
    
<pattern id="patt2" x="0" y="0" width="0.25" height="0.25">
      
<rect x="0" y="0" width="50" height="50" fill="lightblue" />
      
<circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="url(#grad1)" fill-opacity="0.8" />
    
</pattern>
  </defs>
  
  <rect width="200" 
height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" />
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" />

width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="200" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="grad1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="white" />
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="red" />
    </linearGradient>
    <pattern id="patt2" x="0" y="0" width="0.25" height="0.25">
      <rect x="0" y="0" width="50" height="50" fill="lightblue" />
      <circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="url(#grad1)" fill-opacity="0.8" />
    </pattern>
  </defs>
 
  <rect width="200" height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" />
</svg>

<rect width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" />

width="200" 
  height="200" x="0" y="0" stroke="black" fill="url(#patt2)" /
